TopicTitle: Messed Up Orbit after SOI Change

Articles.Content:
**Problem:** Orbit Changes after SOI Change from Kerbin to Kerbol. Messing up my Transfer.

**Mods installed:**

List from KSP AVC ingame:

KSP: 1.0.2 (Win32) - Unity: 4.6.4f1 - OS: Windows 7 Service Pack 1 (6.1.7601) 64bit

Chatterer - 0.9.5.86

Contract Configurator - 1.2.5

Contract Pack: Anomaly Surveyor - 1.2.2

CC-CP-SCANSat - 0.5.2

Contract Pack: RemoteTech - 1.1.4

Contract Reward Modifier - 1.0.2

Contracts Window Plus - 1.0.5.1

Flight Manager for Reusable Stages [FMRS] - 1.0

KAS - 0.5.2

Kerbal Construction Time - 1.1.7

Kerbal Engineer Redux - 1.0.16.6

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement - 3.1.3

KIS - 1.1.5

KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5

Infernal Robots - 0.21.2

ModularFlightIntegrator - 1.0

Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 6.2

Final Frontier - 0.8.2.1285

Procedural Parts - 1.1.3

RCS Build Aid - 0.7.1

RCS Sounds - 4.3

RealChute - 1.3.2.3

RemoteTech - 1.6.5

SCANsat - 1.1.2.1

SETI-CommunityTechTree - 0.8.4

StageRecovery - 1.5.6

TAC Fuel Balancer - 2.5.1.7

TAC Life Support - 0.11.1.20

Trajectories - 1.3

Kerbal Alarm Clock - 3.3.2.1

Transfer Window Planner - 1.3.0.1

TweakScale - 2.1

but it lacks some:

Tweakable Everything

Trajectories (installed after Problem occured)

Toolbar

ToadicusTools

Sentinel Memory Monitoring Unit

ScienceAlert

RoverWheelsounds

Procedural Fairings

PreciseNode

Module Manager

Kerbal NRAP

Kerbal Joint Reinforcements

KAC

KAS Portable ScienceContainer

FinalFrontier

FieldExperience

FAR

EVAManager

DockingPortAlignmentIndicator

ContractFilter

Community TechTree

CollisionFX

Coherent Contracts

Everything installed via CKAN and up to Date!

What happens exactly:

PreStart i quicksaved. When starting and reaching Orbit and going for the Interplanetary Burn, everything is fine. Until i reach SOI Border from Kerbin. Once i cross it, my Orbit is ruined. When i quickloaded and redid the steps it happened again. I am not warping when crossing the SOI border. Even when watching from Space Center Screen, the Problem happens. 

Output\_log: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/xqnyjnxx9265hb5/output_log.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xqnyjnxx9265hb5/output_log.txt?dl=0)

Pre SOI Change: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/5i0iflyec32449e/KSP%202015-06-07%2005-02-08-02.jpg?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/5i0iflyec32449e/KSP%202015-06-07%2005-02-08-02.jpg?dl=0)

Post SOI Change: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/x9f5u3j7wm6ofq7/KSP%202015-06-07%2005-05-17-71.jpg?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/x9f5u3j7wm6ofq7/KSP%202015-06-07%2005-05-17-71.jpg?dl=0)

When more Information is required, i will try my best.
Erm you could try burning for a really short time (0.1 m/s)... It would mess up your orbit just a little bit but it might fix the problem.
